data.meta_description: Myren Harris (4) RB  - 2023:  Named the GLIAC Offensive Back of the Year as well as First Team All-GLIAC...it was the first time that a Panther won the award...single-season

2024 Football Roster

Walter Cronk

ON THE MOVE PHOTOGRAPHY

4 Myren Harris

Class Redshirt Senior

Position RB

Ht./Wt. 5-11 / 220

Hometown Clinton Twp., Mich.

Highschool Chippewa Valley

Bio

Related

Stats

Historical

Biography

2023: Named the GLIAC Offensive Back of the Year as well as First Team All-GLIAC...it was the first time that a Panther won the award...single-season record holder at DU with 976 rushing yards on 153 carries with four touchdowns...also caught 14 passes for 129 yards and a score which came against Ferris State...led the GLIAC in three different categories including rushing yards, rushing yards per game (97.6), and yards per carry (6.38)...also ranked in the top 25 nationally in Division II in those same categories...had a great stretch of games during the season in which he rushed for 100-plus yards in six straight games...also broke the school record with 161 rushing yards against Wayne State on October 14...also completed a 33-yard touchdown pass on his only attempt of the season against William Jewell...named GLIAC Offensive Player of the Week after the William Jewell win.

Prior to DU: Attended Wayne State University in Detroit.

2022: Named to the GLIAC All-Academic Team ... named to the All-GLIAC Second Team ... played in all 10 games, starting five contests ... had a team-high 13 rushing attempts at Slippery Rock along with a nine-yard reception ... rushed for 70 yards and had two catches against Shaw ... totaled two rushing touchdowns on a team-best 72 rushing yards vs. Wisconsin-La Crosse ... caught four passes for 41 yards against Grand Valley State ... rushed for 27 yards vs. Northern Michigan ... notched the third-highest rushing total in Division 2 by gaining 295 yards on 36 carries at Michigan Tech to earn WSU Offensive Player of the Week honors ... also had a nine-yard reception and a 16-yard kickoff return to compile 320 all-purpose yards ... rushed for two touchdowns and 76 yards at Davenport ... notched a team-high 13 carries against Saginaw Valley State ... had a rushing touchdown versus Ferris State ... played on the kickoff return team vs. DU ... led the squad with seven rushing touchdowns, and was second in both scoring with 42 points and all-purpose yards with 783 ... GLIAC Regular-Season Rankings (GLIAC Games Only): Finished second in rushing yards (471) and rushing yards per game (78.5), third in rushing attempts (92), tied-for-third in rushing touchdowns (5), and seventh in yards per carry (5.1).

2021: Voted to the All-GLIAC First Team ... selected WSU's Offensive Rookie of the Year ... finished second nationally in yards per carry (7.847), which included six carries of at least 45 yards ... the 7.847 yards per carry ranks fourth in school history for a single-season (min. 50 rushing attempts) ... appeared in the first nine games, starting the last three contests played ... rushed for 85 yards on 12 carries in collegiate debut vs. Slippery Rock and had a seven-yard touchdown reception, which put WSU ahead 14-10 in the second quarter ... had three carries and two receptions vs. Truman ... rushed for 57 yards and a score, plus had two receptions at Missouri S&T ... led WSU with 73 receiving yards against Saginaw Valley State, including one for a touchdown ... rushed for a game-high 126 yards and two touchdowns at Northern Michigan to earn WSU's Offensive Player of the Week award ... gained 230 yards on 20 carries vs. Michigan Tech with one touchdown (recorded the then second-highest yards per carry for a game in school history - 11.5 -- Joique Bell 12.23 vs. Mercyhurst [26-318] on Sept. 16, 2006) ... notched third consecutive 100-yard effort by rushing for 137 yards and one touchdown at Davenport in first collegiate start ... led the squad with 53 rushing yards at SVSU and also threw a two-yard TD pass ... eclipsed the WSU single-game rushing record by accumulating an NCAA Division 2 season-best 327 yards on 20 carries with four touchdowns against Northwood ... shattered Joique Bell’s yards per carry by averaging 16.4 vs. the Timberwolves to earn GLIAC Offensive Player of the Week honors (and WSU Offensive Player of the Week) ... had 11 carries for 235 yards and three TDs at intermission) ... became the 19th 1,000-yard rusher in school history vs. NU ... also saw playing time on kickoff return in three games ... missed the final two games with an injury ... had two receptions of at least 25 yards ... ranks third in school history for a single-season at 7.80 yards per play (min. 50 plays) ... NCAA Regular-Season Rankings: 12th nationally in rushing yards per game (114.2), 25th in rushing yards (1,028), 28th in all-purpose yards per game (130.2), 40th in rushing touchdowns (9), and 50th in total touchdowns (11) ... GLIAC Regular-Season Rankings: led the league in rushing yards per game and yards per carry, second in all-purpose yards (1,172), all-purpose yards per game and rushing yards, third in rushing attempts (131), rushing touchdowns and points per game (7.3), and fourth in points (66).

High School: A 2020 graduate of Chippewa Valley High School ... was a two-year letterwinner for coach Scott Merchant ... selected as captain of the Detroit Free Press Dream Team ... received First Team All-State accolades from both the Detroit Free Press and Detroit News, as well as Associated Press ... earned Honorable Mention All-State recognition from the Michigan High School Football Coaches Association (MHSFCA) ... voted Macomb County Player of the Year ... was a finalist for MLive Player of the Year ... named to the MLive Dream Team First Team ... selected to the 2020 MHSFCA All-Star Game ... served as a team captain in both football and basketball.

Personal: Majoring in integrative professional studies...born on December 2...favorite athlete is Kobe Bryant...favorite sports team is the Detroit Lions.
